title: Is The Chase fixed? The Beast aka Mark Labbett goes on record revealing all

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter celebs newsletter follow @mirrortv subscribe

text:
Is The Chase fixed? The Beast aka Mark Labbett goes on record revealing all The star has offered to take a lie detector test on The Jeremy Kyle Show Share Comments By Nicola Agius 22:38, 9 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Doctor gets medical question wrong on The Chase Watch this video again Watch Next The Chase contestant causes uproar over her name 0:31 The Chase contestant has saucy sideline career as 0:59 The Chase contestant gets ridiculously easy quest 0:26 Are these some of the worst drivers in the UK? 1:30 The robot that went into the hidden depths of Fuk 1:22 Shocking video of mum-of-two screaming in pain re 0:33 Canadian women wrestle on floor of fast food joint 0:36 Watch LIVE: Amazing snowfall in Time Square 0:01 Victoria's Secret Angels in New York ahead of Val 0:18 Topless women demonstrate for the right to go top 0:30 Gloria Hunniford shows us her new dog and it's th 0:37 Video will play in The Chase's Beast reveals why he stormed off the set Share this video Watch Next Share Comments Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email The Chase has been hit with countless claims that the show is fixed.
Now, The Beast - aka Labbett - has spoken out on record to reveal the truth.
During an interview with The Express , he insisted that the Bradley Walsh-fornted programme is 100% real.
"I have never thrown a question, let alone a show and would happily be strapped up to one of Jeremy Kyle’s lie detectors," he said.
The Chase has been hit with countless claims that the show is fixed and now, The Beast - aka Labbett - has spoken out on record to reveal the truth (Photo: ITV) "Social media is great for people’s immediate gut reactions but not for a more considered opinion. My guess is that people get caught up in the excitement of the final chase and it boils over."
Mark's comments come after he made headlines in December for punching a wall and storming off set after being defeated by contestants on The Chase which saw them go on to win an incredible £60,000 to share between three.
The star denied the Bradley Walsh-fronted show is fake (Photo: ITV) Presenter Walsh tried to play down the incident, saying to the cameras: "That just shows you how they take it."
Read More The Beast reveals why he punched wall and stormed off The Chase set in 'sore loser' meltdown But Mark later explained that he should have won the game but producers took an answer away from him.
Mark made headlines in December for storming off set (Photo: PA) He then defended his meltdown by comparing himself to a sportsman.
"That went wrong. I’d won the game to I’ve lost it. Now any sportsman would tell you, when that happens, it hurts," he added.
*The Chase returns to ITV tomorrow at 5pm
